page.title: 04TELEVISION
page.content: Nearly everyone has a{television.}They have about 4 or 5 channels. Television starts at 6 a.m.From 6 a.m. to 9 a.m. there is{breakfast television.}This includes latest traffic reports, news, and the weather. The presenters interview famous people and sometimes give cooking recipes. After 9 a.m. until lunch time there are mostly {younger children's programmes}on for the children that are too young to go to school. In the afternoon there are mostly programmes for the{housewives. Childrens programmes are after school time. The news is on at midday, early evening and at 9 or 10 p.m. The evening T.V. consists mostly of{soap {operas}(which are serials about exaggerated modern lifestyles) films documentaries quiz programmes drama and chat shows.
